page.title: 03A DAY OUT WITH MY FAMILY
page.content: We got up early on a Sunday morning ready to leave to go to the Peterborough Truck Festival. When we left it was about 8 o'clock and we got there between ten and half-past. When we got there the weather was fine but after about twenty minutes it started raining. There were lots of the big American trucks that had been customized, e.g. dralon furnishings, television, cocktail bars, stereo hi-fi's etc. Geoff Capes, Noel Edmunds and Barry Sheen were there but I didn't see them. In some of the lorries you were allowed to look inside - I saw some of them but there were so many people you couldn't get to them. There was a big fun-fair and I went on that. We had rolls, crisps and cakes in the car, then went back and by that time the rain had died down.
